input_text:
Job Title: IT Project Manager

Location: Albuquerque, NM

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Information Technology, Project Management

Description:
Come be a part of something big! Smart Minds, Cool Jobs, and Awesome Rewards! Fueled by innovation, talent and ambition, the Air Force Civilian Service (AFCS) is seeking civilian professionals prepared to deploy war-winning capabilities on behalf of the United States Air Force.
The Air Force Civilian Service (AFCS) is currently seeking candidate for an IT Project Manager, GS-2210-11 in Albuquerque, NM. 
This position can close at any time. Apply Now!
Salary: $67,240 –$87,407 

Qualifications/Requirements:The primary purpose of this position is: To serve as a technical advisor to local installation information technology (IT) users in the area of policy and plans as related to IT systems.
Supporting Customers / Developing projects: Understand and develop customer Telecom requirements. Advise customers on appropriate processes/procedures for success. Produce documentation for contract award or coordinate on Tech Evals of proposals with SME’s. Ensure technical prerequisites are installed to provide phone/network/system services upon building occupation. Prepare documentation for leaders to understand required purchases or funds needed for planned project. While most of these are not technical in nature, personnel with knowledge & experience in a specific Cyber/Telecom area are most successful in this position.
Ensure resume shows the knowledge, skills and abilities requirements below: -U.S. Citizenship
-Must be able to obtain and maintain a Secret clearance.
-A BICS Registered Telecommunications Project Manager (RTPM) and/or Project Management Program, Project+, Process Improvement is highly desired.
-Knowledge of organization’s policy and planning formulation process along with its missions and objectives to prepare IT polices and plans.
-Knowledge of budgetary processes, cost-benefit analysis methods, and analysis of performance data to prepare budget recommendations in support of IT requirements.
-Knowledge of systems architecture, integration techniques and testing methods.
-Ability to analyze complexities of existing technology, reviews, revises, and develops policy, initiates plans for enhancements, and provides management sufficient technical and cost analysis information, through written documentation and oral briefings, to render informed judgments.
-Ability to maintain an up-to-date awareness of technological advances and predict how management can meet future requirements.
Click the apply button to complete an application and upload resume (PDF or Word Doc) and/or additional documents (Transcripts, certifications, Vet Docs (DD214), SF-50).
For tips on how to write a Federal Resume, checkout the following link(s): https://afciviliancareers.com/PDF/FederalResumeWriting.pdf
To receive additional information about current and future job openings with AFCS via email notification, please register at www.Afciviliancareers.com and sign up to “Get Career Updates.”
AFCS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. U.S. citizenship required. Must be of legal working age.

Experience Level (if available): Associate

Advises customers on appropriate processes and procedures for success.
Coordinates on Tech Evals of proposals with SME’s.
Ensures technical prerequisites are installed for phone/network/system services upon building occupation.
Prepares documentation for leaders to understand required purchases or funds needed for planned projects.
